cards.title: Verbatim strings
cards.body:
```cs {.wrap}
string longString = @"I can type any characters in here !#@$%^&*()__+ '' \n \t except double quotes and I will be taken literally. I even work with multiple lines.";

cards.title: Verbatim strings
General .NET Terms
cards.back: A collection of services that are required to execute a given compiled unit of code.

cards.title: General .NET Terms
cards.back: Primarily locates, loads, and managed .NET objects. The CLR also handles memory management, application hosting, coordination of threads, performing security checks, and other low-level details.

cards.title: General .NET Terms
cards.back: Code that compiles and runs on .NET runtime. C#/F#/VB are examples.

cards.title: General .NET Terms
cards.back: Code that compiles straight to machine code and cannot be directly hosted by the .NET runtime. Contains no free memory management, garbage collection, etc. DLLs created from C/C++ are examples.
